hedline.hl1: Build a Missile Shield? The Debate Rages On

abstract.p: Mike Glueckert letter on Apr 28 article cites need for missile defense system

block.p: In your April 28 front-page article ''Documents Detail U.S. Plan to Alter '72 Missile Treaty,'' Stephen I. Schwartz, the publisher of the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, said, ''The United States government would forsake deep reductions in the Russian and American arsenals in favor of deploying a limited missile defense against a threat that doesn't yet exist.''

In your April 28 front-page article ''Documents Detail U.S. Plan to Alter '72 Missile Treaty,'' Stephen I. Schwartz, the publisher of the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, said, ''The United States government would forsake deep reductions in the Russian and American arsenals in favor of deploying a limited missile defense against a threat that doesn't yet exist.''

Should we wait for Muammar el-Qaddafi, Saddam Hussein or some other despot to have the necessary means to destroy an American city before trying to develop and deploy this system? The missile defense system that the United States is trying to build is still a ways off, and it must be in place when the threat is real for it to be of any use at all.
MIKE GLUECKERT Woodland Park, Colo., April 28, 2000
